intro: Oligocarpha, commonly known as the "green alder," is a member of the Betulaceae family. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in moist, acidic soils. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are catkin-like, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. Oligocarpha is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other riparian habitats.
